website_summaries.verdict: A sensitive wireless motion detector at the higher end of the pricing spectrum. May falter at detecting vehicles in bad weather.
pros: Wind and weather don't cause false alarms
cons: Inclement weather may hamper vehicle detection

customer_reviews.title: Ruined a good product
customer_reviews.text: A former driveway reporter user. Was very happy, I have had this chamberlain version for over 3 years now. With the old unit, nobody could walk/drive up without me knowing. Now I either get 4 false alarms everyday with low sensitivity, med range or I get people knocking on my door with no warning, low sensitivity, low range. Tried every combination of settings. Have been very disappointed with this. Wish I knew he was going to sell out, would have bought a couple of spares. The false alarms were to much, I now keep it at the low setting and it does let me know about 1 out of 5 times when someone comes up.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fortin

customer_reviews.title: Hardly ever detects human bodies or motion :(
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this unit to act as a door chime for a business entrance (2 glass doors/french style opening). The height of the motion detector was about 2.75 ft off the ground. If I were to put a percent on its effectiveness for our situation, sadly, it would only be 20-40% of the time. It's most effective when we are scrubbing the glass clean... I have adjusted the sensor and distance, to no avail. We REALLY wanted this to work! Good thing rummage sale season is coming soon. Too late for us to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: have perfect hearing?
customer_reviews.text: in theory it is a good unit. When I read the reviews, I thought perhaps they did not turn up the volume, now, I think the volume should be louder as well as set to a lower tone. My wife says it sounds about the pitch of a teapot. I cannot hear it at all. It is worthless to me, but she can hear it, so I guess for her safety, we will keep it. Since many reviews on this product mention the inadequate volume, I wonder why they never corrected it?.
customer_reviews.author: nocona

customer_reviews.title: Unplugging the base station removes the sensor :(
customer_reviews.text: I want to move the base station around in my house but as soon as I unplugged the base, the sensor activations stopped being reported. UPDATE- So I had to take off the cover and bring the sensor inside to pair it with the base again. But now my sensor does NOT pair with the receiver no matter what I try. I cleared the memory, and attempted to repair it many times, each time powering off both sensor (removing batter) and unplugging the base... it just does not want to work. **product does not work as advertised** This is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: tutsi buster lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Great home defense
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect home defense for unwanted crooks. Place the sensor about 5' off the ground on our fence where I park my company truck. Anything that walks between my truck and fence the base unit rings like a doorbell. Plugs into wall outlet and outside unit operates off batteries. Purchased several as gifts, place wherever you want to be alerted, once someone crosses that beam, it rings inside. Has a very long range if you have a clear sight to the detector, not obstructed by trees etc.. I have another unit inside my shop about 50 yards away. Sometimes I forget to close the garage doors and I caught a meth head stealing my chainsaws.
customer_reviews.author: Spiderman

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 2 weeks, then broke. It would turn itself ON after I had turned it off, plus it stop detecting motion. I called the Chamberlain Company to get help, but the 2 tech people were useless. They informed me there was a 1 year Warranty, and Amazon would be responsible for my refund. I contacted Amazon, and they said the return period was over. It was 4 weeks old. I told them the company said 1 Year Warranty. There was a RESTOCKING fee of $8.75. I didn't understand why a company would charge to RESTOCK a broken item; surely they would not resell it. I need another one, but will not buy it from Chamberlain.
customer_reviews.author: TheBreeze

customer_reviews.title: Used to work, new ones are garbage
customer_reviews.text: Like most successful products, the maker starts cutting costs and quality to keep up with volume. Three years ago this was a great product for the price. The last two years, they have turned in to useless garbage. They don't alarm, they don't send alarms to the base unit, and they don't "see" motion other than the occasional bug flying by. So, quit buying these and maybe chamberlain will note the lost sales and correct their QC/function issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty simple system and it does what it is supposed to do. I mounted the sensor a couple of meters up on a tree at the end of my driveway and pointed it down the driveway so it can't be seen from the road. It reliably alerts when people pull in and back out of the driveway. Every once in a while my neighbors giant free-roaming troll of a dog (Great Pyr) will lumber by and set it off just because he is huge but other then that no issues. Don't get ahead of yourself putting it together like I did - you need it disassembled to sync it to the base.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Takes Time to Set Up Well, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the second brand I tried. I thought I saw it had multiple choices for alarm noises, but no. Oh well. It's working great in our rural area (don't have a driveway miles long, though ;) ), and in our really cold (and extended!!) winter. Tip: when setting this up, try to put it up with temporary measures first, to get a good spot/angle/distance. I put ours up with a bungee cord on a tree... and frankly, I'd just as soon leave it that way. Tilting it slightly also helped it to get the coverage and readings I wanted. I didn't have to put it low and aim it for tailpipes, it's just waist-high, and slanted slightly down.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not very loud
customer_reviews.text: We bought this system after our 13-year-old previous alarm finally failed. So far this one has performed well - we'll see how it holds up under winter ice and snow. My main complaint is that the noise it makes is a single, high-pitched tone that is not very loud. The old one gave out two loud buzzes that I could hear when I was at the other end of our ranch-style house. This one I can barely hear two rooms away. We have had to change the location of the receiver to be sure we hear it when it goes off. Otherwise we are satisfied with it. (We have not had occasion to contact tech support.)
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Bischoff

customer_reviews.title: Mom likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Put this up at my mothers house. She lives alone and needed to know when someone comes up the driveway. It took a little experimenting to find the right place for the detection unit. Dogs and cats will set it off if it’s not adjusted correctly. One time ants kept setting it off. After a while, we found a place and direction where it had few false alarms. The battery life on the outdoor unit seems pretty good. Had it for about a year now. It’s a little bit more expensive than other units but it works reliably and has good range.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Alarm only goes off every now and again. My husband went to work this morning, the alarm didn't go off when he left. He forgot his phone, so he came back. The alarm went off on his return. When he left again, no alarm!! As you can see from the pic, the alarm is not too far from the driveway. There should be no reason the sensor won't pick up movement. Our old driveway alarm worked in that spot just fine! The alarm sound it makes (when it decides to work) is very annoying and scares my dog. No way to change the sound to something less irritating. Not a fan of this product.
customer_reviews.author: KSH

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for damp climates
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a damp climate, don't bother with this unit. I even tried building a little shelter to keep the rain off the sensor to no avail. The batteries and the circuit board all corroded and stopped working after only a few months. I actually tried three of them - I needed second base station so I bought another unit. All three had the same moisture problem. The other problem was the volume and pitch of the warning tone. I could hear it but my husband could not. There is no volume adjustment or different tone. When the units were new, they did a good job detecting cars in the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaSam

customer_reviews.title: This is a great motion detector
customer_reviews.text: This is a great motion detector. We have it set so we know when someone enters our front yard. I don't think it actually goes 30ft, closer to 20ft. But, that works for us. We have had very few false alarms. The set up was very simple, we were up and running in about 10 minutes. The receiver can be set at different volumes and even on mute-where the green light will blink at motion, but not beep. The reciever also has a battery compartment for use in case of a power outage, otherwise it is powered by an outlet. We are very happy with this product and definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works really well over long distance
customer_reviews.text: I have it mounted at the end of a very long driveway (a little less than 1/4 mile). However I needed to keep it in line-of-sight with the receiver in the kitchen window to work properly. Made a little peaked roof for it to protect from the elements. Make sure that you have the back cover aligned properly with the antenna lead. I can see where some folks might have done it incorrectly. The big test will be this Winter in NW Wisconsin, but so far am happy with it. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: meadowood

customer_reviews.title: Great before.
customer_reviews.text: Great before....now junk! I have used the Chamberlain driveway alerts for more than 10 years and have been fairly satisfied. This new unit is junk and will not pick up a human walking greater than 8 feet away from sensors (with sensitivity on max). I have no use for this type of junk. I used to rely on them sensing over 20 feet. Very disappointed and will never buy from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: SwampThing

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I'm back on here getting ready to shell out more money for replacements. We ordered this set along with another motion sensor only 18 months ago and they have already quit working. Even before they quit, we had issues with false alarms or not going off at all when customers were actually here. Since we own and run an automotive business, it's quit frustrating to stop working on a customer's vehicle, only to find out once we went to the door that nobody was there or even worse, not hear someone come in. I sure hope the next brand, lasts longer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! It's mounted in our driveway approach, approx 200' from our house. It was easy to install, but be sure and follow the directions to avoid having to reopen the case, which has tiny screws. We have had it since March '18 (little more than a month) and have not had any false alarms...other than the occasional visiting goats from across the way. It's loud enough to hear in other rooms of the house but not too loud when in the same room as the receiver. We would buy this again if we ever need another one. We may purchase another receiver for upstairs but have not felt the need for it as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Works but not consistent.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter sleep walks so I placed it on the floor between the railings at the top of the stairs to hear when she goes downstairs. It works some of the time and is not consistent. I tried different locations along the stairs but it doesn't always beeps when you go by. The base is only 10-15 feet away from the sensor so that I don't think that is the problem. The antenna is free and clear and pointing in the direction of the base so I don't think that is the problem. I am looking into another option at the moment since I need a sensor that works 100% of the time for my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Segal

customer_reviews.title: Advance notice of visitors
customer_reviews.text: None of the local delivery services ring my doorbell when a package is delivered. Now, I know when someone enters my private courtyard, so packages do not sit in the rain. Most of the windows are not visible from the street. Occasionally I do a naked run to the laundry room. This prevents embarrassment. It feels like another layer of safety. No surprises. The noise is not wonderful, annoying actually. It is easy to turn off when I am working in the garden. I knew what I wanted and looked for over a year. This has not had any false alarms or missed a visitor.
customer_reviews.author: uncommon_boston

customer_reviews.title: Flawed but still useful.
customer_reviews.text: Sensors often don't detect me right after the base unit has just been turned on. That is the main flaw I have had. However, I have found that once you turn on the base unit, you need to "wake" up the sensors by setting them off first. This requires standing in front of each one and close up. Once you do this, they will detect me flawlessly. Also, never turn off the base unit once all the sensors are "awake". Just turn down the volume or mute it when you dont need the alarm. I keep the base unit on at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Perrier

customer_reviews.title: Needs Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Motion Sensors work well when new, but moisture and bugs are big issues. Bugs like wasps and spiders crawl into opening causing false alarms, even at night sometimes. Suggest a better Weatherproof housing, a clear window at end of sensor to keep out bugs and water. Needs a redesign to address water inside the case issues too. Receiver could use a low battery indicator for the sensor(s), as the low batteries reduce range of signal. FYI, the only reliable one I have left is inside my Mailbox, shielded from bugs and rain. This is my 7th purchase of these, and may be my last unless improvements are made soon. Send me some Beta units to try. I need 4.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount the sensor to any surface and the ...
customer_reviews.text: After several of my trailers were stolen I bought this "alarm" to alert me when someone was entering my property. I placed several along my 300' driveway and around my shop. Each alarm can be paired with a base station and will have a distinctive beep, ie; one beep when they come through my gate, two & three beeps as they pass by a tree and my shop carport, and four beeps if they enter my shop. Easy to mount the sensor to any surface and the base station is loud enough to hear throughout my 2500 sqft ranch home. Highly recommend, they work great !!!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this home alarm is that it’s light and mobile. You can put the base unit in your pocket and work at one end of your property, with a chime to advise you that somebody is coming. I’d buy it again if they had ruggedized it. It’s advertized as weatherproof, but they didn’t even include a rubber gasket seal to avoid humidity from reaching the circuit board and the batteries. Anyway, one of the base stations failed after just one week, before it got corroded. Don’t buy this if you need a reliable alarm system.
customer_reviews.author: Per Stangeland

customer_reviews.title: This system worked great for about 45 days after installation when it stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: This system worked great for about 45 days after installation when it stopped working suddenly. When I opened the unit to replace the batteries (that's what I thought was the issue), I found that one of the negative posts on one of the 4 AA batteries had MELTED and become disconnected. I hope the seller is good enough to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Golson

customer_reviews.title: Chamberlame Wireless Motionless Alertless Security.
customer_reviews.text: Paid too much for an inferior product! Looks pretty good but works like crap. I have this set-up in tandem with a Driveway Patrol and the DP is the only alarm or chime that I hear letting me know that anyone is walking up my drive. You can buy two Driveway Patrols for the price of one Chamberlain, and have change for gum. I give this driveway sensor a F-, unless you want to detect a semi truck approaching.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman E

customer_reviews.title: Works about half the time
customer_reviews.text: This item works only about half the time. It hardly ever goes off when a vehicle leaves the driveway and only alarms when about half the vehicles come up the driveway. Goes off every time deer walk by it in the morning. Purchased mainly for cars since we have a long driveway. We have adjusted its height, location closer to the house, location closer to the driveway and it doesn’t make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Z

customer_reviews.title: This alarm has worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: This alarm has worked great for me. I can't say it's missed any hits or had any false positives yet. It will detect dogs, deer, kids, and vehicles. If you're in a rural area, you may want to consider putting it on a timer for the wee hours of the night because it'll see every critter that strolls in front of it. It's not the most camouflaged device, but you could camo it on your own. Once you see it, it's easy to spot. It also has a green light in the sensor to show it's been triggered. Not visible unless you're looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F

customer_reviews.title: We live in a very rural area with a long ...
customer_reviews.text: We live in a very rural area with a long driveway, and this unit has performed reliably and in all kinds of weather. We have it mounted on a gate post approximately 200 feet from the house and there has been no problem getting a signal. It has never failed to alert us to an approaching vehicle, and It is sensitive enough that we now know every time one of our dogs heads down the driveway on an expedition. If it's still working this time next year, I'll come back and give it another star.
customer_reviews.author: DPS

customer_reviews.title: It works !
customer_reviews.text: I tried all suggestions to dial it in. Low from the ground did not work. The exhaust idea was not working for me. I located it further back from the drive at the factory recomended heigth and it works great. After weeks of use I have changed my thoughts about the beep being too quiet. It is not . As I relocated and adjusted it , I did find a bug and webbing forming so I assume it may need cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Fred C Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: It's working, kinda
customer_reviews.text: The motion detection is working, kinda. Two complains: the field of detection is not exactly as described, the movement on the right side is working, on the left, not so much. False positives are annoying. I could not detect the source of false positive motions. Maybe flickering lights outside, maybe some reflection of the distant (500 ft) traffic. But the base beeps every 15-20 min.
customer_reviews.author: Old Bookie

customer_reviews.title: Needs tweaks, especially the sound, but once done, it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but the volume and frequency of the tiny receiver speaker is outside of my hearing ability. Solved that problem by adding a sound only baby monitor near the Chamberlain receiver so that it amplifies the beeps into other rooms at a decent level. Mounting the sending unit at 18 inches on the mailbox post, about 100 feet from the house, gives great detection of the entire driveway area. I now have notice when the mailman or guests are arriving.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious as to whether this would work in a mailbox, especially a metal one. I was planning to drill a hole in the back of the metal mailbox and extend the antenna to a quarter wavelength....The mailbox is about 150 feet from the front of the house and is made of steel (responds to magnet). .The back faces the house, and the front, the street. On the first test, I put the sensor in the back of the box, and it worked when opening the box door....set off the alarm in the house with closed front door. Didn't need to extend the antenna outside the box. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Carl23

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am disappoint with volume of the reciever. The system works as advertised. But I have issues with volume of the receiver. I've got it adjusted to FULL volume and I don't hear it unless it's within about 6 to 8 feet of me. Forget leaving the room. To be fair, I am in my 60's and like all old individuals, I have some hearing loose when it comes to higher pitch sounds and this system emits a very high pitch tone. As it is, this is functional for me only if I'm sitting one specific chair in my living room. I'm looking for something different.
customer_reviews.author: Proudpop

customer_reviews.title: Works as described, great motion detector.
customer_reviews.text: Great motion detector. Worked right out of the box. Replacing the batteries are not easy on the motion sensor, if it was easy, anyone who knows you have one of these could disable the device. So, I understand why you must unscrew the senormous tof replace the batteries. Since I purchased the full set, I have purchased two more outdoor motion sensors for this item. The only warning I think I need to give is make sure there are no plants or other outdoor itemseating that might move in the wind, this will set the alarm off. I placed one down my driveway, one along the walkway to my house and one near my workshop in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: R Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works really good. I've tried other brands but this one is way better. It took a little trial and error to get it to detect vehicles reliably but after a few adjustments it is flawless. I may have 1 or 2 false detections a day but it could also be animals of some sort triggering it. Can't attest to how far it works but it works great for me at the 60 yards where I have it set.
customer_reviews.author: calvin

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: We had a Chamberlain Motion detection system for years which worked really well. Eventually when it died we got another one and it stopped working after 2 months. The beep is really annoying (the old unit was a buzzer) and after going through the limited troubleshooting steps provided with the unit, changing batteries, moving the sensor it was obvious that it was hopeless. A waste of money. Don't bother...we will be looking for an alternative brand & model.
customer_reviews.author: clancyfurr

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: This set up easily and seems to work just fine! Have only had it a couple weeks for my mother who often does not hear knocking at the door. I put it about a foot off the ground as others suggested, and it picks me up walking by, as well as my car, but not leaf movement or squirrels. My mother reports no false alarms so far, altho it's not overly loud and sometimes she has not heard it. As a suggestion to the makers, I would make it louder and more like a doorbell chime, rather than the unpleasant high pitched beep that it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Woodhouse

customer_reviews.title: Short lived!  Fails to function in several weeks!
customer_reviews.text: This product failed after only 5 weeks. I am very familiar with the product having previously owned the same system. I have tried replacing batteries, re-pairing the sensors to the base station and all troubleshooting suggestions from the manuals. I have also reached out to Chamberlain support as well as Amazon and have had no response. There is no option for product return on this item. I strongly suggest you NOT buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: DrNautica

customer_reviews.title: CHAMBERLAIN WIRELESS MOTION DETECTORS
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good device...Issues I have for not giviing it 5 Stars...range is misleading...not sure how it will pick up 1/2 mile..also...the numbers 1 and 2 also should show on and off to make it clearer what the settings are..I called cust svs not knowing what to expect and was happy to get a livr body on the line on a Sat afternoon so that got the 4th star
customer_reviews.author: Shug30901

customer_reviews.title: Good Alert
customer_reviews.text: I have used this Chamberlain motion detector now for three years and am extremely happy with the performance. My driveway and entrance gate is a bit away from the house and it is a comfort for me to be alerted when someone enters my gate. I do take the sensor apart each year, replace the batteries and clean the battery contacts. The contacts will corrode over time and must be cleaned. This is a very dependable unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Henson

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but use the DC adapter vs batteries. Review explains why
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. My only recommendation would be to use the DC adapter to power the receiver vs batteries. It’s quite the battery hog even with extremely low announcing. We used batteries while installing the sensor and brought the receiver within hearing range for optimal placement of the sensor. Within 3 days the receiver began to make an odd sound. Through trial and error and another set of new batteries, we determined it was a low battery indicator. After using the DC cord- system is perfect and exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.author: AnnaBelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit, lot smaller than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, lot smaller than I imagined, looked like a toy, but works great and is easy to setup. The sensors are identifiable by the number of beeps the base outputs, 1 beep for sensor 1, 2 beeps for sensor 2, etc..... no way the change the sound or the number of beeps the unit outputs. Seems to work well. Note, This is not a motion detector, as it wont detect an opening of a door or garage door, but rather a passive infrared sensor that detects heat, from a human, large animal or automotive engine in a car....
customer_reviews.author: drewman

customer_reviews.title: This alarm is very disappointing. We received it and ...
customer_reviews.text: This alarm is very disappointing. We received it and were so excited to use it because we have a 400 foot driveway but it only seems to work intermittently. We have tried new batteries with no difference. It is past the return date so we are stuck with an alarm that does not work. Do NOT buy this product. Look elsewhere!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: 2 bad units delivered in a week
customer_reviews.text: Unbox. Install batteries. Setup to test. No workee. Lights blink, beeper beeps. Does not alarm. Reread instructions, disassemble, check everything. Tried cross testing with older unit. Nada. Pack up, return, repeat. Ad nausium. Opted for replacement unit. The second one lasted 5 minutes. You had to open the sensor and reset it for anything to happen.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Speed

customer_reviews.title: works perfect !
customer_reviews.text: i have the sensor mounted at the entrance of my driveway 600 ft in a straight line away from my house. its an S shaped drive going through thick woods, the sensor nor the house can be seen from either end of the driveway. this thing works flawlessly !! i have it mounted 3 foot off the ground and aiming toward the ground on the other side of the driveway so its not set off off by blowing branches or grass. i absolutely love it ! it has not failed yet even during heavy snow. batteries are still working and its approaching the 6th month mark now.
customer_reviews.author: BCA356

customer_reviews.title: used these for 10 years and just now replacing one of them.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very good ! No problems then the occasional sensitivity. It's the shipping I am concerned about, shipped in it's own box,with a shipping label stuck right on it, with no protection from dropping (it's and electronic item!!) , no protection from the original box getting damaged. I was shocked. Hoping it works when I set it up !
customer_reviews.author: BLT

customer_reviews.title: Great! Works as advertised to alert me, good distance, very simple utility
customer_reviews.text: Works great! No issues with water damaging the units, if you put the shield on. I'm still tweaking it a bit, since on Low sensitivity it won't set off by the car, but on high it seems like a few stray cats are triggering it. My GF woke me up the other night to say it went off, and I think it was just animals. I'll keep working on it. We love it, and I don't feel like committing to a camera, just want to know when the delivery guy comes down the driveway, or people are pulling up, we can't see the front from our window,
customer_reviews.author: rpamz

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed. I purchased this unit along with another sensor
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat disappointed. I purchased this unit along with another sensor, because my parents have had theirs for years, and while it does work, the alarm is so quiet, even at full volume, that you have to be in the same room as the receiver to hear it.My parents older model you can hear anywhere in the house, even on the second level. I called Chamberlin and their response was sorry, who knows how long it sat in Amazons warehouse, you could send it back and reorder. However, after reading other reviews I don't believe that will cure the problem. Sadly it appears that is just the way they are made now.
customer_reviews.author: CEH

customer_reviews.title: Working 100% even in forested area
customer_reviews.text: We need an alarm for a 700 foot curvy driveway in a heavily forested area. I bought and tried out two more expensive driveway alarms. The $100 one worked great about 50% of the time, the $150 one did not work at all due to the trees on our property. So far, the Chamberlain alarm is working perfectly 100% of the time! The only reason that I don’t give it 5 stars is that the only sound option is a short, annoying beep. I would love if it had at least a couple more choices but overall very happy that it is doing the job that we need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Angela K Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Started out ok but after a week needs constant reprogramming...DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: The system is ok but alarm is very high frequency and not very loud. I have a cheap alarm I use also and while it does not have the range its impossible to miss. Some reviews said alarm volume issue had been addressed but not on my very recent purchase. It's a shame because the rest of it is great. UPDATE: After a few days the unit looses some of the sensors and they have to be reprogrammed.......It is a pain. DO NOT BUY This unit is very unreliable. I bought it because my family is at home at night when I am working. I have now purchased a different brand at a lower price and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: The Hammer 7366

customer_reviews.title: I do like the system
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to contact seller for assistance. I do like the system, but the volume is so low it is hard to hear, unless we are sitting right by the control we do not know that vehicles have passed through. The control on the device will not adjust the volume. The volume control is the only issue, but since we live out in the country we depend on the alarm alerting us that someone has entered our property.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for me
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money for me. I bought 2 sensors and the receiver unit. The documentation on setting the Dip switches was not clear on the orientation of the switches so I still don't know if they are set correctly. The sensor units must be disassembled in order to change the switches. The units usually alarm if you stand directly in front of them but fail if you walk by at a normal pace. The driveway sensor has detected one vehicle out of 100 chances. I will be going with a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry P.

customer_reviews.title: Very good, happy I bought it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty cool. Very affordable option. We live out in the country so it goes off a fair amount just from wildlife but there is no way around that. Sometimes it doesn't seem to pick up a vehicle, but then it will always pick up every vehicle for a few weeks. A little confused on the consistency because I must have it placed well if it gets trigger the majority of the time. I wish it was able to go louder.
customer_reviews.author: Wallis Mead

customer_reviews.title: Two years and still working on the original batteries
customer_reviews.text: Ours has been out in the weather for the last two years protecting our carport, still operating on the original batteries and is located about 300 feet from the base unit which is behind two interior walls and one exterior wall. It always alerts nice a loud and has never failed. Only once I had to go clean off a spider web from the sensor which gave false alarms. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: Just not sure about this product. It is super sensitive or my driveway is a highway for the critters. We followed all the directions and have adjusted it in many ways. It goes off at night all the time. We live in the country on a road that is not traveled a lot with 10 houses on the block. It definitely is loud enough even on the quietest setting. It is just really sensitive to movement.
customer_reviews.author: lilangelsmom

customer_reviews.title: No longer made or supported by Chamberlain.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know about tech support because it wasn't needed. This thing works great. No false alarms. Not sure how long the batteries last on the outdoor unit. Have had it for 45 days. Perfect. Update 10/08/2019 * 14 weeks after install batteries went dead in outdoor unit. Unit had a lot of moisture inside cleaned it up ,put in 4 new batteries works well again. It is not waterproof.I applied some teflon clear grease to the mating surfaces and ordered some small desiccant packs to insert inside the sensor. Was hoping for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Suneshop

customer_reviews.title: Works but, Beep tone is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Unit works as expect. Setup was a bit frustrating. Out of the box with one sensor the base station would beep 6 times. Honestly the "beep" tone is rather annoying, sounds like a dying cat. I tired calling support but was put on endless hold for over 30 minutes. Decided to fix this on my own. There is NOTHING in the instruction book about resetting the base station, had to figure it out on me own. Hold down the learn button on the base station for 30 seconds. This clears the memory. You can then re-learn your sensor(s) in the correct order you would like. My sensor now beeps one time which is all I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: JD33

customer_reviews.title: Need to learn how to use it to avoid false positives
customer_reviews.text: The device was delivered in a timely manner and very well packaged. Perhaps, I am just a novice with the device, but I receive an awful lot of false negatives. I am not sure if the device senses the movement of a blade of grass or a wayward leaf rustling in a very light breeze. Perhaps, I have the sensitivity set too high so that causes false positives. For now, I have stopped using the device because of the high number of "hits" when nothing seems to be present.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Fitt  "SCC man"

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase !
customer_reviews.text: This product works.Everyday. True story- neighbors mother(with Alzheimer's) walked up our driveway at 3am. We were alerted-saw someone outside our home-called 911. We determined no threat- brought the lady inside to sit and drink some water.Deputy came-all turned out okay. We are rural- lady walked 1/2 mile plus. Glad older lady wasn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: PETER T.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money....
customer_reviews.text: This product sucks, I adjusted the sensitivity, height of sensor and range. Doesn’t pick up people, cars or ATVs. It only alarms if I was within a foot of the sensor. I even combed over the reviews and tried all the tips, still nothing.... not impressed, and will be returning it promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: I am a unbiased reviewer. This alert system is very well built, better than most, would probably last a long time, however, the alarm is a single beep that is no way loud enough. The reciver is near my front door and when I'm upstairs I can't hear it at all. Only when I'm in the same room. Other reviews have stated this also. If Chamberlain would make one with optional multiple beeps or volume at least twice as loud, I would definitely buy it. It's a well made product, just no where near loud enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: lynch's

customer_reviews.title: it did a good job. But considering the price one would think ...
customer_reviews.text: While it worked.... it did a good job. But considering the price one would think that it would last awhile. Purchased on July of 2017, recently stopped working. Hopefully a warranty will fix or replace. Update: Contacted customer service. As one reviewer stated, a representative will take you through problem-solving to determine issues. Basically reprograming to determine whether that will solve the issue. Had to wait 20 minutes and then call again because that did not solve problem. So it was time-consuming dealing with customer service, two different times, but they did stand behind their product as it was still under warranty. They will be sending a new sensor.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money if your trying to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Product didn’t work as expected. Bought this for my long driveway (about 600’). The sensor worked find when it was in close proximity to the base, but once I hooked it up at the beginning of my driveway, the signal wouldn’t get back to the base. I even set the brain in my front porch about 600 linear feet away from the senor without any obstructions and it still didn’t work. Waste of time and money if your trying to get anything over a few hundred out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Pina The Wonder Dog

customer_reviews.title: This unit has proven itself over & over again.
customer_reviews.text: This product has exceeded our expectations. October 2013 we moved to a rural location in Maine, very long driveway that is blind to the living area of the house. We installed this Chamberlain System and we have never been surprised. The warning gives us plenty of time to make visual i.d. and react accordingly. January 2016 the original batteries finally had to be replaced. This unit owes us nothing and with a rash of drug related robberies in the area, we will be looking to add more sensors to eliminate other possible approaches to the house. This was an after thought in our home awareness-alarm-defense system, but has become the lynch pin to all of it.
customer_reviews.author: N Wright

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for two years before Four AA Batteries in the Detection Unit needed replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Good signal strength over 600 feet. Units failed after a few years, Electronics in the Detection unit failed - replaced batteries as was usual after every two years and the fifth time they never reactived (two units) Failed same time, at same age of ten years. Good service up until then. Replaced with Solar Powered Units with Rechargeable Batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Carr53

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Mounted a little too low (3 ft off ground) and gets set off by roaming stray cats and dogs at night. Adjusted to about 4.5 feet and it's perfect. Now I know when packages are delivered since delivery services are too lazy to ring doorbell LOL. Works well in rain as well, no issues with motion detection.
customer_reviews.author: KYEMT325

customer_reviews.title: Works every time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same product 12 years ago, at that time, it went under a different name, (Reporter), it worked great until the last year when the sensor would only pick up movements within 6 feet. Since the Chamberain replaced the Reporter, I went ahead and ordered this one. This unit works just as great as the Reporter did. So far, I've used it for almost 3 months, sensed every vehicle & animal that went by, very few false alerts, probably from moths or butterflies flying right next to the sensor. A new added feature with this one was the adjustable volume and an on/off button. I'd def purchase this same model when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome P

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this in my driveway to try to catch a thief who has been breaking into cars in my neighborhood. The signal makes it from my driveway to my back bedroom which is about 150 feet in distance. I knew the distance would not be a problem but the signal is also going through 3 solid steel reinforced concrete walls and that is impressive. As far as I know it has detected all the people and vehicles entering and leaving my driveway. I am very happy with my purchase. It also lets me know when an expected package is delivered and when my kids get home from school or try to sneak out.
customer_reviews.author: Persnickety Client

customer_reviews.title: Several years outside, still working!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing has been a great "doorbell" for us when someone pulls up to our gate. We have to keep the weeds cut around it or it'll just go off over and over, but otherwise a good device. We've had to replace batteries several times but our gate is about 500 yards from our sensor and it comes through fine.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: I have a single sensor setup. The base is ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a single sensor setup. The base is 115 feet down the driveway and works on both bodies and cars, even in 20 degree weather. I did not need to change the default setting for low sensitivity. When triggered, the base makes a high pitched squieeel~ beeps. not the nicest, volume is still too loud at the bottom of the range, so I masked the speaker with duct tape. I am trying to figure out if a second and third sending unit will make unique beeeeeps! ?
customer_reviews.author: Jon M. Chu

customer_reviews.title: Great all around driveway alert system
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a while ago and just had the time to install it today. Driveway alert seems to work great for normal use. I have a long driveway and drove past around 20 mph and it did not pick up my car. I slowed down to 10-15 mph in forward and reverse and and the alarm picked up fine while hooked to the power adapter. The system didn't pick up in my house while on battery power but I did not have new batteries installed so that conclusion is irrelevant. My only concern about this system is the lack of options for the audible alarm. The alert tone itself isn't very loud and no other tones are offered.
customer_reviews.author: Ajm

customer_reviews.title: Good motion detection poor battery packs
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these units now and they have all failed the same way. After a while the plastic battery holders flex from the spring pressure and allow the batteries to pop out. Customer service will do nothing to fix the problem and told me find new battery holders on my own.
customer_reviews.author: ikemay1215

customer_reviews.title: GOOD but sensitive to false alerts when used outdoors
customer_reviews.text: A good system but not great...Three star rating only because it is very sensitive to wind....BUT is a good WIND alarm if needed....I don't want to be to harsh but the product functions as declared. The spec's mention triggering by animals and passer by's but that certainly not a concern compared to false wind blowing alerts. I like the ability to discern different sensors and the ability to raise and lower the alert volume...The size is compact for what it does....Please see my earlier review on the sensor for this same device...
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawslessly for 3 yrs and 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: The product did exaclty what it was supposed to do at roughly 600' through trees and house wall. Then it unexpectantly stopped working, the sensor lights up with motion, the base station powers on, but I can't get it to sync. Presume it is the Sensor, but not sure. I would have given 5 stars if it lasted longer...ok not fair, but I have stereo tuner over 30 years old!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for large properties
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these at the two entrances to our home and on the back gates. They work perfect. When a car or person goes by we get an alarm in the house. The sensors are about 150 yards from our home. They get wet from our sprinklers and the rain and have not had any issue. They came in a green color and I pained them to match our home colors. These are the best warning system that someone is in your driveway or your about to get a package. All 5 have been easy to program and the batteries have been in them for over 8 months. Great low tech detection device that is very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Happy buyer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FINE AT 300FT DISTANCE.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install the sensor and adjust it. Receiver is a plug in and forget until it beeps. Very little adjustment and orientation. Great driveway warning. This is a second one to replace the previous one we had for some years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why so quiet?
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one of these that we have bought and really loved the others. The others worked well and this one works but unless you are in the room with it you cannot hear it go off. We bought another Chamberlain cause we like to be notified from any room in the house that someone was coming up our road. Yes it is up all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device.
customer_reviews.text: Great device.. the battery life is exactly!! what the owners manual claims... I have the transmitter up hill from me about 120 feet?? works well.. my ONLY complaint is the alarm "beeper' should be louder... if you have your Stereo on in any form that one who grew up in the 70's and 80's does.. you may not hear this... today's college kids who listen to that heavy bass on their I phones.. will not have a problem hearing the alarm... good product, works as stated.. yes.. I WOULD buy another.. but dont expect it to jar you up at sleep like your smoke detector alarm would.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Serbin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, could use a couple improvements though.
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty good, as others have noted though it is a little less adept at picking up vehicles as it is at picking up warm bodies (people, animals, etc). I did find one source of false positives, there is bridge work taking place near me and must be the heavy vehicles our road commission use have some kind of radio equipment that sets off the alarm as every time one of their vehicles goes by it goes off. Also while a minor annoyance it would have been nice if they included at least a few different chime options, the one provided with the unit is pretty bland.
customer_reviews.author: Ano223

customer_reviews.title: A good security device!
customer_reviews.text: This version (2.0, I suppose) is wayyyy better than version 1.0 -- at least as far as the alarm is concerned. Version 1.0 emitted a VERY loud, annoying buzz. Version 2.0 emits a beep which is loud enough to hear in the next room but won't scare you to pieces. You DO have to play with the sensor (1.remove, 2.adjust, 3.reattach, 4.test. 5.repeat 1-5.) to get it adjusted to where and what you want it to detect. In this regard, it would be nice if came with a Velcro strap or some such. We used reusable zip-ties to attach ours to a small tree, which also makes it easier to replace the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: leigh

customer_reviews.title: No Ringtone Choices!
customer_reviews.text: We had to return this unit because the sound coming from it sounds like a smoke detector and scares our dog (rescue who must have had a bad experience with one). The product is limited to only this sound, and in today's age of technology, that is really unacceptable. It's a shame because the product did work and is reasonable priced. We ended up going with a Guardline unit which has about 30 ring tone options. We use the beeping car horn for the driveway. Barking dog sound for the back yard door. Door Bell for front porch. Loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Failure of a product for a long driveway
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing, I researched best driveway motion sensors and Chamberlain came up as being the best for long range. We have tried mounting it in a variety of locations, heights, and distances from approaching vehicles. It picks up people on foot and cars that drive incredibly slow. But if anyone zooms down the long driveway (as teenagers and potential trespassers are wont to do) it will NOT detect the vehicle. And that it my definition of a failure of a product.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Lyman aka Wendy Ramer

customer_reviews.title: I want to know when someone is coming.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these for two years now and now have a total of 4 detectors. The range is fantastic. I have the receiver in my house but have transmitters on my road the neighbors lot where he stores construction equipment and on at a neighbors a whole block away because he was having a problem with an unwanted guest. Works great but added in a smoke detector for louder alert.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: ok thats good. Still no alarm
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the set plus an extra sensor for the back drive. All was well and then started noticing that they werent working all the time. Checked batteries. ok thats good. Still no alarm. Our driveway is short in front and nice to know if someone is coming in. Now we are down to one sensor. Very reluctant to replace it. Whats wrong went through the trouble shooting answers?? Really need to two sensors.
customer_reviews.author: KauLilly

customer_reviews.title: Very Reliable, I regularly recommend these to a bunch of people now.
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. After 5 months, the batteries show no sign of dying, and so far, Ive caught 3 people letting their dog crap in my driveway and 1 homeless guy digging through my garbage. My only complaint is that they don't detect very far away. 20 ft maybe. Otherwise, they work like a charm, haven't let me down yet. Theres a slight delay of a second or two before it reports anything though, but that hasnt been an issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tat2dbull

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: Got it all together and set it up in the house to test. Rarely went off when I walked in front it (10-15 feet away). Put it outside (clear view of about 100 feet in front of the motion unit) and it goes off randomly for several minutes...with nothing in front of it. It goes off enough that I just turned it off till I can mess with it. I may give it some time before I put it in a drawer or return it. As of now, I would not buy it again. Its been about 2 days of testing. Batteries are brand new.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: wasn't sure what to expect with so many mixed reviews however i installed mine about a foot or so high and it works great in fact so well it picks up neighborhood cats so i need to lift a few more inches, definitely worth the money, i definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: This is a life safer!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this driveway alarm! I wanted an alarm out in driveway coming to my shop, so I would know if people or cars were coming down the drive. I had a homeless person walk in on me, when I was alone. I wanted something to alarm me before someone hits my door. This works like a charm! A small price to pay for this type of security. Others mentioned it wasn't loud enough, but I think its plenty loud. I have not had any problems with this device since I started using it about 6 wks ago.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gosselin

customer_reviews.title: We have two units over 100 ft. away from the base and they work as they advertised.
customer_reviews.text: My family, including our small company, purchase many items from Amazon because we do not have money to waste. We’re reviewing some items purchased a while ago after truly using them fully over time because we know how important an honest review is to others before deciding to buy any item. This motion detector works perfect. We have 2 of them, one outside our front gate at the driveway entry, and one in the back (in case). Each are over 100 ft. away from the base unit and work as they advertised. We would purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick K.

customer_reviews.title: 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 3 years. I attached it to a tree on my driveway. It is about 350 ft from the base unit. I love it. Usually the only time it doesn't work is if the batteries are getting a little low. Even then I can typically go a year on the same set of batteries. It does trigger when deer and other large animals walk in front, but that is ok with me. So far so good! Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This thing works
customer_reviews.text: I have it situated about 400' from the house, over a small rise and through trees and brush. After I got it adjusted it never fails and seldom gives a false alarm. I do wish there was some way to link it with my phone for when I'm not in the house.
customer_reviews.author: David Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Unfriendly to baby monitors withing a half mile radius...
customer_reviews.text: The product description fails to mention that it operates on the same frequency as many baby monitors. What that means is that every baby monitor for a half mile is going to go off every time the motion detector is triggered. If you live in the middle of nowhere or you don't mind the problems this thing causes your neighbors, its great! For my purposes...I sent it back. I was hopeful that this thing would help me to keep my property safe, but I can't stomach the amount of inconvenience it causes for everyone around me. It would have worked well...I think.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a quality piece
customer_reviews.text: The sensitivity switch set to less sensitive was not picking up movement at 10 feet (supposed to work up to 15 feet) n the sensor batteries lasted only 1 week! But after I replaced the batteries the sensor started to pick up objects at 10 feet n the batteries are goin on three weeks now... Not sure if the sensor reset, or the first batch of batteries were bad, but it seems to be working fine now I like that it seems to be a quality part......or at least if the cost is equal to what a quality piece would cost I like that the base station is AC powered......one less thing to replace batteries in......
customer_reviews.author: OSWALDO TAPANES

customer_reviews.title: Can't go without it after being used to having one.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Chamberlain Motion Alert I've purchased. The one I purchased about 4 years ago stopped working after the rain shield blew off and I didn't notice it until after a heavy rain. I looked at other models but decided to purchase the same one as the range is good and it is at least 100 yards from the driveway entrance to our house. I realized how much I missed getting the alerts when my older one stopped working. A FedEx man was at my front door and I didn't hear a thing until the door bell rang. I don't like surprises at the front door.
customer_reviews.author: Summer928

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a sensor in my barn. These are great systems. I have three now. They all work great. I highly recommend. I have a long driveway and it is nice to know ahead of time when someone is coming up the drive. I couldn't tell if someone was here if I was in the barn so I ordered one for there also. I highly recommend to anyone. My dogs even know when to check to see who is coming up the drive when they hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Defective and knockoff product!!!!  DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Bought three sensors, they do not work unless less than 1 foot away, not 30 feet or even 3 feet away. I called Chamberlin directly for tech help, they said “DO NOT buy from Amazon” as they sell many defective, returned or knock off products. I believe them, they are junk!
customer_reviews.author: JD Rusty Fender

customer_reviews.title: Yet another failed motion detector
customer_reviews.text: Set up went fine and tested perfectly. I was so pleased that I didn't get awakened during the night by false alarms like the last two motion detectors did, HA-434RTL and 1byone Wireless Home Security Driveway Alarm. Both returned) Then I went out this morning and discovered it wasn't working. I tried to re-establish the connection between the detector and base station multiple times with no luck. I don't see anywhere to ask for support in my amazon order area like most products, so back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Brahm

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to setup and the connection seems to work pretty well. There's only been a couple of instances where it didn't pick up a car, but in fairness we did not install it at a higher level off the ground yet so that is likely why. We use this in combination with Arlo security cameras and it's a good combo. We live at the top of a big hill and I like knowing when someone is on the property.
customer_reviews.author: munkeyhoots

customer_reviews.title: This unit did not work and I am happy that Amazon agreed to take it back
customer_reviews.text: This unit did not work and I am happy that Amazon agreed to take it back. I talked to Chamberlain help line before I gave up on it. They told me they have many customer complaints with this unit as the volume does not work and you can not hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A Thomas

product_meta.title: Chamberlain Group CWA2000 Chamberlain Driveway Alert, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThe Chamberlain Motion Sensor with Wireless Motion Alert is a convenient and affordable safety / security system. It features weatherproof outdoor sensor with adjustable sensitivity control. The sensor may be placed up to a ½ mile from the base unit. Alerts with light and sound when vehicles or pedestrians approach within a 30 feet radius. Expandable up to 4 sensors, it is perfect for home, business, property and worksite.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Chamberlain Wireless Motion Alert is a Convenient and affordable safety / security system. Perfect for home, property and worksite.Please refer user manual (Page No 3) for trouble shooting steps
feature_bullets: Set includes one base receiver and one sensor (ability to additional CWPIR sensors sold separately)
Passive infrared (PIR) sensor is weatherproof and detects motion up to 30 feet away and features adjustable sensitivity
Base receiver detects signals from sensors up to a 1/2 mile away (in ideal situations)
Unique sound and light pattern on the base unit identifies which sensor has been triggered
Easy to install, no wiring required. Base units uses AA batteries or included AC adapter; Note: Check user manual in technical specification before use
